explains: adj. 炽热的；最新的；热烈的；非常激动的
n. 热狗；法兰克福香肠

sentences.en: Red-hot coals glowed in the fire.
sentences.cn: 炽热的煤炭在炉子里发光。

sentences.en: The race was won by the red-hot favourite.
sentences.cn: 夺标呼声最高的最受欢迎的选手获得了比赛的胜利。

sentences.en: He cauterized the wound with a piece of red-hot iron.
sentences.cn: 他用一块烧红的烙铁来给伤口进行烧灼治疗。
